required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Induction Chemotherapy and Toripalimab for Larynx Preservation in Resectable Laryngeal/Hypopharyngeal Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Induction Chemotherapy and Toripalimab Followed by Surgery or Radiotherapy for Larynx Preservation in Resectable Laryngeal/Hypopharyngeal Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to define whether combination of induction chemotherapy and PD-1 inhibitor (Toripalimab) improve the rate of larynx preservation, for patients with resectable laryngeal/hypopharyngeal carcinoma.

detailed_description.textblock: Historically, induction chemotherapy could provide a chance of larynx preservation for approximate 60-70% of patients with locally advanced laryngeal/hypopharyngeal carcinoma. Recently, phase I-II clinical studies demonstrated excellent pathological response of induction PD-1 inhibitor with/without chemotherapy for locally advanced head and neck cancer. The aim of this study is to define whether combination of induction chemotherapy and PD-1 inhibitor (Toripalimab) improve the rate of larynx preservation, for patients with resectable laryngeal/hypopharyngeal carcinoma.

primary_outcome.description: defined as the absence of any residual disease that would justify salvage total laryngectomy

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall response rate of induction therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks after the 3th cycle of induction therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Overall response rate of induction therapy evaluated by head and neck MR/CT, laryngoscopy using Recist 1.1 Criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Pathological complete response rate of the patients receiving surgical resection
secondary_outcome.description: Pathological complete response rate of the patients receiving surgical resection, evaluated by experienced pathologists

secondary_outcome.measure: Major pathologic response rate of the patients receiving surgical resection
secondary_outcome.description: Major pathologic response rate, defined as no more than 10% of residual viable tumor, evaluated by experienced pathologists.

other_outcome.measure: Laryngeal Preservation rate at 3 month post-radiotherapy by different biomarker subgroups
other_outcome.description: Experimental Biomarker Analysis: the relationship with different biomarkers and 3 month laryngeal preservation rate

other_outcome.measure: Overall response rate of induction therapy, by different biomarker subgroups
other_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks after the 3th cycle of induction therapy
other_outcome.description: Experimental Biomarker Analysis: the relationship with different biomarkers and overall response rate of induction therapy

other_outcome.measure: Pathological complete response rate by different biomarker subgroups
other_outcome.description: Experimental Biomarker Analysis: the relationship with different biomarkers and pathological complete response rate of the patients receiving surgical resection

other_outcome.measure: Major pathologic response rate by different biomarker subgroups
other_outcome.description: Experimental Biomarker Analysis: the relationship with different biomarkers and major pathologic response rate of the patients receiving surgical resection

arm_group.description: Induction chemotherapy TP regimen combined with Toripalimab for 3 cycles: Toripalimab 240mg d1, Paclitaxel 175mg/m2 d2 or Nab-Paclitaxel 260mg/m2 d2，Cisplatin 25mg/m2 d2-4 q3w. Response rate of primary tumor is evaluated using laryngoscopy and head and neck MRI after 3 cycles of induction therapy. If ORR of primary tumor is CR/PR, then chemoradiation is conducted, followed by maintenance therapy of Toripalimab for 1year. Otherwise, surgery is conducted (laryngeal preservation surgery is preferred), followed by adjuvant radiation/chemoradiation and then maintenance therapy of Toripalimab for 1year.

intervention.intervention_name: chemotherapy TP regimen combined with Toripalimab
intervention.description: Induction chemotherapy TP regimen combined with Toripalimab for 3 cycles: Toripalimab 240mg d1, Paclitaxel 175mg/m2 d2 or Nab-Paclitaxel 260mg/m2 d2，Cisplatin 25mg/m2 d2-4 q3w. Response rate of primary tumor is evaluated using laryngoscopy and head and neck MRI after 3 cycles of induction therapy. If overall response rate of primary tumor is complete response or partial response, then chemoradiation is conducted, followed by maintenance therapy of Toripalimab for 1year. Otherwise, surgery is conducted (laryngeal preservation surgery is preferred), followed by adjuvant radiation/chemoradiation and then maintenance therapy of Toripalimab for 1year.
